channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MI

item.title: Report E-2024120052
item.description:
Report E-2024120052

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: WARREN
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1739 ET, XPO-XPN notified ERTS of a cargo release. It was reported that approximately 10 gallons of 251 roll film released from a metal drum due to improper loading. The release impacted inside trailer#435-4042. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Product was containerized into (1) 85-gallon poly drum along with oil-dri.

item.title: Report E-2024120050
item.description:
Report E-2024120050

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-06T12:24:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0133 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XDE. It was reported that approximately 2 ounces of Celogen 754A was released from a 55-pound bag in a box due to a forklift puncture by terminal XCL during loading at their terminal. The release impacted the plastic wrap around the boxes only at dock door 87. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and they felt comfortable cleaning up the release with PPE available on-site. Called Infotrac and spoke to Wil. Report #377722. Terminal placed Celogen 754A into (1) 55-gallon metal drum.

  • Description: CALLED TO HAZMAT AUDITOR OFFICE FOR POSSIBLE UNDECLARED PACKAGE. UPON INSPECTION PACKAGE WAS FOUND TO CONTAIN 2 1 GALLON CONTAINERS OF A PAINT RELATED PRODUCT TUFF STUFF HIGH BUILD EPOXY PRIMER AND TUFF STUFF HIGH BUILD EPOXY CATALYST. OUTER CARTON HAD NO HAZARDOUS INDICTIONS OR WARNINGS. ADDITIOANL TRACKING NUMBER: 1Z3845470399001194.

item.title: Report E-2024120020
item.description:
Report E-2024120020

Identified by scraper @ 2024-12-05T12:24:28+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: ROMULUS
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 15-gallon drum containing hazardous product, Nalco Stabrex#ST70. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 0.5-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2'x2' area as a result of improper loading/inadequate preparation for transportation. The contractor used sodium bicarbonate to neutralize the release and applied oil dry to clean-up the spill. The damaged drum was overpacked into one 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. The neutralized and impacted oil dry was containerized into a separate 55-gallon DF for waste disposal. XPO will manage all waste generated from the spill response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.
